alert.note: Alert for Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 3:08AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM THROUGH TODAY... .A winter storm tracking offshore of southern New England today will bring a period of locally heavy snowfall rates to south-central New Hampshire and southwestern Maine through this morning. Snowfall rates will then temporarily decrease late this morning before increasing again for a few hours this afternoon as low pressure strengthens offshore. Wet snow may also fall along the coasts of Maine and New Hampshire. Additionally, strong gusty winds along the coastal plain and into the interior are expected. When combined with wet snow, this may lead to power outages and when combined with drier snow, would produce localized whiteout conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 7 inches. * WHERE...Southern Somerset County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...A weather system will bring a period of snowfall to the region. Although snowfall amounts will be light to moderate, travel will still be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on roads.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
